body:
This brings us one step closer to #15559, so :+1: from me! Good research on the existing `Formatter` type. The name collision is unfortunate, but it brings up an interesting question: since the existing `Formatter` type is only used internally, could we rename it to e.g. `LoadedFormatter`, freeing up `Formatter` for the publicly-consumable type?

Question for the team: as we're working on typing ESLint's codebase as part of #15559, **are existing internal `@typedef`s stable public API?** If we renamed the existing `@typedef Formatter` below, which is only used internally, to free up the name for the type of format functions for the public API, **would that be a breaking change?**

https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/802c85c28283362d48d77876e924fd381a15f573/lib/eslint/eslint.js#L39-L43

I think we shouldn't treat changes in JSDoc typedefs as breaking. Regardless of that, in this particular case the existing `Formatter` type is used in the return type of the public method [`eslint.loadFormatter`](https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/nodejs-api#-eslintloadformatternameorpath), so it might be less disruptive to figure out another name for the signature of [formatter functions](https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/working-with-custom-formatters) (for example, `FormatterFunction`)?

Thanks for the feedback @mdjermanovic. I have to say, I also call it `FormatterFunction` in my projects, because I don't know any better name. But @btmills' suggestion seems very reasonable to me. At least it would make things clearer, especially because people seem to think that the type `Formatter` is - what else? - the type of a formatter, despite the documentation making it clear that it's used for something different. I've seen this myself generating [some confusion](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/discussions/58761#discussioncomment-2169486) in discussions, so I guess it's not only my impression. But anyway, adding a type for a formatter with whatever name should already help disambiguating the ideas, so maybe a more conservative naming choice could be actually a good option.

> I think we shouldn't treat changes in JSDoc typedefs as breaking.

That certainly simplifies a lot for us at this stage if we can get away with it. At some point, weâ€™ll need to declare the types part of the stable public API, but having flexibility now would make the transition easier.

Thanks @fasttime for the link to a conversation where the ambiguous name was unhelpful. Perhaps we should both call the new type `FormatterFunction` and rename the existing `Formatter` type to `LoadedFormatter` to avoid any ambiguity?

> Perhaps we should both call the new type `FormatterFunction` and rename the existing `Formatter` type to `LoadedFormatter` to avoid any ambiguity?

Good idea :+1:

`Formatter` could be interpreted as either of those, so it seems best to remove that ambiguous name in favor of the two more concrete ones `FormatterFunction` and `LoadedFormatter`.
Iâ€™m ðŸ‘ for getting more type information into the repo. What are the next steps here?
If the consensus is for renaming `Formatter` to `LoadedFormatter` and calling the new type `FormatterFunction`, that would be fine. I guess this change doesn't need a RFC, right?

> I guess this change doesn't need a RFC, right?

This is non-breaking and not externally visible, so I wouldn't say so.

We have three :+1:s from the team, so marking this as accepted. @fasttime are you still willing to submit a PR for the rename and new type?
@btmills Thanks for accepting this. Sure, I will work on a PR.

issue.title: docs: disambiguate types `FormatterFunction` and `LoadedFormatter`

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
Fixes #15654

<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[x] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[x] Add something to the core
[x] Other, please explain: type definitions changed, see below.

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

* Add type `FormatterFunction`
* Rename type `Formatter` to `LoadedFormatter`
* Use `FormatterFunction` in the return type of `CLIEngine.getFormatter`
* Move type `LintResult` to shared types because it is referenced by `FormatterFunction`
* Fix a misspelling of `LintResult` in JSDoc
* docs: Update/clarify some text about custom formatters
* ~~docs: Rename variable `formatter` to `loadedFormatter` in code examples~~

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->

I don't think there is a way to test type definitions or any other of the changes listed above at this time, so probably everything needs a careful human review.
